thresholds.threshold:
WBC >11,000/mm³ (evaluate for infection or inflammation)
- Low: WBC <4,000/mm³ (concern for marrow suppression or immunocompromise) 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Hematology referral if WBC >30k or <2k without clear etiology
- Persistent or worsening leukopenia or leukocytosis without explanation

next_steps: - MCV 80–100: Normocytic anemia (consider renal function, retic count)
- MCV > 100: Macrocytic anemia (consider B12, folate levels)

Hemoglobin / Hematocrit.emr_followup:
Hemoglobin / Hematocrit: when value is low, consider the following actions:
- Evaluate MCV to classify anemia:
- - MCV < 80: Microcytic anemia (consider iron studies)
- - MCV 80–100: Normocytic anemia (consider renal function, retic count)
- - MCV > 100: Macrocytic anemia (consider B12, folate levels)

thresholds.threshold:
>450,000/mm³ (evaluate in clinical context) 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Hematology if platelets <50k, >1 million, or unexplained changes
- Hospitalize if active bleeding with severe thrombocytopenia

next_steps: Check for recent viral illness, medications, and peripheral smear

Platelets.emr_followup: Platelets: when value is low, consider the following actions:\n- Check for recent viral illness, medications, and peripheral smear

thresholds.threshold:
MCV <80 fL
- High: MCV >100 fL 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Refer if unexplained macrocytosis or microcytosis with normal iron/B12/folate

130–134 mEq/L
- Moderate: 125–129 mEq/L
- Severe: <125 mEq/L 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Refer or hospitalize if Na <120, neurologic symptoms, or unclear cause

146–149 mEq/L
- Moderate: 150–159 mEq/L
- Severe: ≥160 mEq/L 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Severe or symptomatic hypernatremia
- Suspected central or nephrogenic diabetes insipidus

HCO₃⁻ <22 mEq/L
- Severe: <16 mEq/L (urgent) 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Refer to nephrology or hospitalize if cause not clear or patient unstable

HCO₃⁻ >30 mEq/L
- Moderate/Severe: >35 mEq/L 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Persistent alkalosis with unclear cause or unstable patient

110–125 mg/dL (impaired fasting glucose)
- Diabetes: ≥126 mg/dL fasting or ≥200 mg/dL random
- Urgent: >300 mg/dL or symptoms of DKA 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Consider endocrinology for new or poorly controlled diabetes
- Urgent care if DKA suspected

60–70 mg/dL
- Moderate: 50–59 mg/dL
- Severe: <50 mg/dL 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Refer to endocrinology if recurrent, unexplained, or severe hypoglycemia

≥14 mg/dL 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Endocrinology if primary hyperparathyroidism or unclear etiology
- Hospitalize if calcium >14 or symptomatic

ALT/AST <3x upper limit of normal
- Moderate: 3–10x ULN
- Severe: >10x ULN 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Refer to hepatology if ALT/AST persistently elevated >3x ULN or unexplained

up to 2x ULN
- Moderate to Severe: >2x ULN 👩‍⚕️ Referral Threshold
- Hepatology referral if persistent elevation with no clear source
